He crouched behind a stack of rusting metal barrels, the cold seeping into his worn jeans, his breath misting in the frigid air.  Three heavily armed figures patrolled the warehouse floor, their shadows stretching long and distorted in the flickering gaslight. Elias could hear the muffled cries coming from the back room, hostages – another variable in his rapidly evolving equation.

His power, the ability to calculate probabilities with lightning speed, wasn't flashy. It didn't allow him to bend steel or control the weather.  It simply told him what was most likely to happen.  And right now, the most likely outcome was a bloodbath.  He squeezed his eyes shut, focusing, letting the torrent of data wash over him.  The trajectories of bullets, the structural integrity of the building, the psychological profiles of the gunmen – every detail fed into his mental algorithm.  He could see the potential futures branching out before him like a tangled web, each thread representing a different course of action, each weighted with its own probability of success.  Most led to failure, to the hostages being executed, to him being captured, or worse.  He needed to find the one thread, the one improbable path that led to a different outcome.

His fingers traced the outline of a small, metallic disc in his pocket – a probability disruptor he'd been developing. It was untested, volatile, a desperate gamble. Its purpose was to introduce a controlled element of chaos, to nudge the probabilities in his favor, but the potential side effects were terrifying and unpredictable.  He could end up shifting the odds in a way that made things even worse.  He glanced at the hostages' location, the gunmen's patrol patterns, the layout of the warehouse, the weather patterns outside, the potential for police intervention.  A thousand variables spun in his mind, each one a factor in his complex, ever-shifting calculations.

He opened his eyes, the probabilities coalescing into a coherent plan, a series of highly improbable actions that, when executed with precise timing, offered the slimmest chance of success.

La Cour des Comptes a rendu public aujourd'hui son rapport d'audit sur l'Agence de Régulation des Télécommunications et des Communications (Artec).  Le document, fruit d'une enquête approfondie, met en lumière plusieurs dysfonctionnements au sein de l'agence, soulevant des questions quant à son efficacité et à sa gestion des fonds publics.

L'Artec, créée il y a dix ans, a pour mission de réguler le secteur des télécommunications, de veiller à la concurrence et de protéger les consommateurs.  Or, selon la Cour des Comptes, l'agence n'aurait pas pleinement rempli ses objectifs.  Le rapport pointe du doigt un manque de transparence dans les procédures d'attribution des licences d'exploitation, ainsi qu'une insuffisante surveillance des opérateurs.

L'un des points les plus critiques du rapport concerne la gestion financière de l'Artec.  La Cour des Comptes a relevé des irrégularités dans l'attribution de certains marchés publics, ainsi que des dépenses non justifiées.  Des sommes importantes auraient été allouées à des consultants externes, sans que leur contribution réelle soit clairement démontrée.

Le rapport souligne également un manque de personnel qualifié au sein de l'Artec.  L'agence souffrirait d'un déficit d'expertise technique, ce qui l'empêcherait de mener à bien ses missions de contrôle et de régulation.  Ce manque de compétences se traduirait par une incapacité à anticiper les évolutions du marché et à adapter sa réglementation.

La Cour des Comptes met également en avant l'absence d'une stratégie claire à long terme.  L'Artec n'aurait pas défini de plan d'action précis pour les années à venir, ce qui rendrait difficile l'évaluation de son efficacité et la mesure de ses progrès.  Ce manque de vision stratégique fragiliserait l'agence et compromettrait sa capacité à s'adapter aux changements du secteur.

Le rapport de la Cour des Comptes a suscité de vives réactions au sein du gouvernement.  Le ministre des Télécommunications a annoncé la mise en place d'une commission d'enquête parlementaire afin d'examiner les conclusions du rapport et de proposer des solutions concrètes.  Il a également promis une réforme en profondeur de l'Artec afin de garantir son efficacité et sa transparence.

Les opérateurs de télécommunications ont également réagi au rapport de la Cour des Comptes.  Ils ont exprimé leur préoccupation quant aux dysfonctionnements relevés et ont appelé à une clarification des règles du jeu.  Ils ont également insisté sur la nécessité d'une régulation plus efficace et plus transparente afin de garantir un marché équitable et concurrentiel.

Les catastrophes naturelles ont frappé avec une force dévastatrice au cours des deux dernières décennies, laissant derrière elles un coût économique colossal.  Selon un nouveau rapport, les pertes liées à ces événements climatiques extrêmes s'élèvent à près de 3000 milliards de dollars depuis l'an 2000.

Ce chiffre alarmant souligne l'impact croissant du changement climatique sur la planète et la vulnérabilité des populations face à ces phénomènes.  Les ouragans, les tremblements de terre, les inondations et les sécheresses ont tous contribué à ce bilan financier désastreux.

L'augmentation de la fréquence et de l'intensité de ces catastrophes est directement liée au réchauffement climatique, selon les experts.  L'élévation du niveau des mers, les températures extrêmes et les précipitations plus abondantes sont autant de facteurs aggravants.

Les pays en développement sont particulièrement touchés par ces catastrophes, souvent moins équipés pour faire face aux conséquences économiques et humaines.  La reconstruction des infrastructures et la mise en place de mesures préventives représentent un défi majeur pour ces nations.

Le rapport met en garde contre l'escalade des coûts futurs si des mesures concrètes ne sont pas prises pour atténuer les effets du changement climatique.  L'investissement dans des infrastructures résilientes et la réduction des émissions de gaz à effet de serre sont des priorités absolues.

La communauté internationale doit se mobiliser pour aider les pays les plus vulnérables à s'adapter à cette nouvelle réalité climatique.

The advent of diffusion models has marked a significant leap forward in the realm of generative artificial intelligence.  These models, capable of generating high-quality and diverse data across various modalities, including images, audio, and text, have rapidly gained traction in research and commercial applications. Their power lies in the ability to learn the underlying data distribution by iteratively adding noise to training samples and subsequently learning to reverse this process, effectively synthesizing new data points from pure noise. This unique approach distinguishes diffusion models from other generative techniques, such as Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs) and Variational Autoencoders (VAEs), and has led to remarkable advancements in areas like image synthesis, super-resolution, and inpainting.  However, despite the significant progress in improving the technical capabilities of diffusion models, a critical challenge remains: ensuring that the generated content aligns with human preferences and values.

The primary focus in developing diffusion models has often been on maximizing the fidelity of generated samples, prioritizing the accurate replication of the training data distribution. While this objective has yielded impressive results in terms of visual realism and diversity, it has also revealed a potential disconnect between technical performance and practical utility.  A model might generate technically flawless images, yet these images could lack the specific attributes desired by a human user, be it aesthetic appeal, semantic coherence, or adherence to certain stylistic guidelines. This disconnect highlights the need for a more nuanced approach to evaluating and optimizing diffusion models, one that goes beyond simply measuring the similarity between generated and real data.  The challenge lies in bridging the gap between the quantitative metrics typically employed in model training and the qualitative aspects that define human judgment and satisfaction.

This research paper addresses this crucial challenge by proposing a novel framework for aligning diffusion models with human utility.

Automated readability assessment (ARA) plays a crucial role in ensuring effective communication by tailoring text complexity to the target audience. While traditional ARA methods often rely on shallow linguistic features, recent advancements in natural language processing (NLP) have opened up new avenues for capturing deeper semantic and syntactic nuances, leading to more accurate and robust complexity prediction.  Concurrently, the subjective nature of text acceptability, particularly concerning its appropriateness and comprehensibility for a specific audience, poses significant challenges for automated assessment.  Existing approaches primarily rely on costly and time-consuming manual annotations, hindering large-scale application and refinement of acceptability prediction models.  This research investigates the potential of leveraging multi-task learning (MTL) with self-supervised annotations to enhance both complexity and acceptability prediction in the context of Italian academic writing.  We introduce UmBERTo-MTSA, a novel framework that builds upon a powerful multilingual language model, specifically trained on Italian text, and extends it with an MTL architecture designed to jointly learn complexity and acceptability features.

UmBERTo-MTSA addresses the limitations of traditional ARA methods by incorporating contextualized word embeddings and utilizing a multi-task learning paradigm. The framework leverages the rich semantic representations captured by the pre-trained UmBERTo model, which has demonstrated superior performance in various NLP tasks for Italian.  By training the model on both complexity and acceptability prediction tasks simultaneously, we aim to exploit the shared underlying linguistic structures and dependencies that influence both aspects of readability.

Reinforcement learning (RL) offers a powerful framework for developing intelligent agents capable of learning complex behaviors by interacting with an environment.  However, the standard RL paradigm often necessitates extensive online interaction, which can be impractical, expensive, or even dangerous in real-world scenarios involving physical systems like robots or sensitive infrastructure.  This limitation has fueled the growing interest in offline RL, a promising alternative that allows agents to learn purely from pre-collected datasets, bypassing the need for direct environment interaction during the training process.

Offline RL presents a unique set of challenges. The fixed nature of the dataset limits the agent's exploration capabilities, making it susceptible to distributional shift, where the agent's learned policy deviates significantly from the behaviors observed in the dataset, leading to suboptimal performance or even catastrophic failures.  Moreover, the quality and diversity of the offline dataset significantly influence the learning process.  Datasets lacking sufficient coverage of the state-action space can hinder the agent's ability to generalize to unseen situations.  Furthermore, noisy or inconsistent data can introduce biases and impede the learning of robust and reliable policies.

Behavioral cloning (BC), a straightforward imitation learning technique, emerges as a potential solution for offline RL. BC focuses on directly learning a policy that mimics the actions observed in the dataset, effectively bypassing the explicit reward optimization process typically employed in RL algorithms. This simplicity makes BC computationally efficient and particularly appealing for scenarios where access to a reward function is limited or defining a suitable reward function proves challenging.  However, BC also suffers from limitations, primarily related to its susceptibility to compounding errors.  Small discrepancies between the learned policy and the expert demonstrations can lead to accumulated deviations, resulting in poor performance, particularly when the agent encounters states outside the distribution of the training data.

To address the shortcomings of BC in offline RL settings, researchers have explored various techniques to improve its reliability and robustness.  These efforts focus on strategies to mitigate distributional shift and enhance the generalization capabilities of the learned policies.  One approach involves incorporating regularization methods to constrain the learned policy within the support of the offline dataset, preventing the agent from taking actions that were not observed in the training data.

Another promising direction involves leveraging the insights from offline RL algorithms to enhance BC.  Methods like uncertainty estimation and conservative policy optimization can be combined with BC to guide the learning process towards more robust and reliable policies.  By estimating the uncertainty associated with the learned policy, the agent can prioritize actions with higher confidence, reducing the risk of taking potentially harmful actions in unseen states.

Furthermore, advancements in representation learning have shown potential for improving the performance of BC in offline RL.  Learning effective state representations allows the agent to capture the underlying structure of the environment, enabling better generalization to unseen states.  Techniques like contrastive learning and autoencoders can be used to learn representations that are robust to variations and noise in the data, leading to more reliable and consistent performance.

This paper investigates the reliable conditioning of behavioral cloning for offline reinforcement learning.  We delve into the challenges and opportunities associated with applying BC in offline settings and propose a novel framework for enhancing the reliability and robustness of learned policies.

The author of "The Challenge of Exploring Venus" effectively argues that studying Venus, despite its hostile environment, is a valuable scientific endeavor.  They achieve this by presenting a compelling case built on the planet's unique characteristics, potential insights into Earth's climate future, and the technological advancements spurred by such a challenging mission. While acknowledging the extreme surface temperatures, dense toxic atmosphere, and crushing pressure, the author doesn't shy away from the difficulties.  Instead, these obstacles are framed as motivators for innovation and exploration, driving the development of robust technologies with potential applications beyond Venus.

The author emphasizes Venus's geological similarities to Earth, highlighting its potential to reveal crucial information about planetary evolution and the runaway greenhouse effect that has drastically shaped Venus's climate. This comparison underscores the importance of understanding Venus to potentially mitigate similar effects on Earth.  Furthermore, the article details the potential for robotic exploration and atmospheric analysis, suggesting feasible methods for data collection despite the hazardous conditions. By outlining the specific scientific goals and technological solutions, the author transforms Venus from an insurmountable challenge into a compelling and achievable target for exploration, ultimately convincing the reader of the significance and worthiness of such a pursuit.

The dull drone of Mr. Harrison's voice washed over ten-year-old Leo, a wave of monotonous sound crashing against the shores of his boredom.  Quadratic equations danced mockingly on the whiteboard, their cryptic symbols a language he couldn't decipher.  His mind, a restless butterfly, flitted away from the algebraic wilderness, seeking refuge in the familiar comfort of his sketchbook.

Under the cover of his textbook, Leo's pencil danced across the page.  He wasn't drawing anything in particular, just letting his hand guide him, creating an intricate tapestry of lines and curves.  A circle formed, then another inside it, connected by delicate, spiraling lines.  Smaller circles blossomed within the larger ones, each a tiny universe of its own.

Unconsciously, Leo began incorporating symbols he'd seen in an old, leather-bound book he'd found tucked away in his attic.  Strange, angular characters, unlike any alphabet he knew, flowed from his pencil, weaving themselves into the growing design.

He added shading, the graphite deepening the lines, creating a sense of depth and dimension.  The design pulsed on the page, a strange energy emanating from its intricate heart.

Suddenly, a faint hum filled the air.  The classroom lights flickered, casting dancing shadows on the walls.  Mr. Harrison paused mid-equation, a puzzled frown creasing his forehead.

Leo stared at his drawing, his heart pounding in his chest.  The air around the sketchbook crackled with an unseen energy, a tingling sensation prickling his skin.

The lines on the page began to glow, a soft, ethereal light emanating from the center of the circle.  The hum intensified, resonating deep within Leo's bones.

A gust of wind swept through the classroom, rustling papers and sending textbooks tumbling to the floor.  The temperature dropped dramatically, a sudden chill replacing the stuffy classroom air.

The glowing intensified, the light spilling over the edges of the sketchbook, bathing the room in an otherworldly radiance.  The air shimmered, distorting the familiar surroundings.

For a moment, time seemed to stand still.  Then, with a blinding flash, the light vanished.

Silence descended upon the classroom, broken only by the rapid thump-thump-thump of Leo's heart.  He looked down at his sketchbook, his eyes wide with disbelief.

The drawing was gone, replaced by a blank page.  But the air still crackled with residual energy, a silent testament to the extraordinary event that had just transpired.

潮湿闷热的浴室，是霉菌滋生的温床，尤其在梅雨季节或气候潮湿的地区，更容易出现恼人的霉斑、湿气，不仅影响美观，也可能危害健康。想要打造一个干爽舒适的卫浴空间，除了保持通风外，正确的卫浴用品收纳也至关重要。以下三种收纳方法，帮你轻松告别浴室里的霉菌和湿气。

首先，善用悬挂式收纳。毛巾、浴巾等容易吸水的物品，如果直接堆放在一起，很容易滋生细菌，也难以快速干燥。利用挂钩、毛巾杆等工具，将毛巾、浴巾悬挂起来，可以有效促进空气流通，加速水分蒸发，避免潮湿环境的形成。此外，选择透气的材质，例如金属或塑料材质的收纳架，更有利于保持干燥。

其次，巧妙运用抽屉式收纳。对于一些常用的洗漱用品，例如牙刷、牙膏、洗面奶等，可以采用抽屉式收纳盒进行整理。将这些物品分类放置，不仅可以保持台面整洁，也能避免它们直接暴露在潮湿的空气中。选择带有沥水孔设计的收纳盒，更能有效防止积水，减少霉菌滋生的可能性。

第三，考虑壁挂式收纳。充分利用浴室的垂直空间，安装壁挂式置物架，可以放置洗发水、沐浴露等瓶瓶罐罐，避免它们堆放在地面或浴缸边缘，造成潮湿和凌乱。选择带有防护栏的置物架，可以防止物品滑落，更加安全可靠。

除了以上三种收纳方法，定期清洁浴室也是保持干爽的关键。每周至少进行一次彻底清洁，清除地面、墙壁和缝隙中的污垢和霉斑。可以使用专业的浴室清洁剂，或者自制天然清洁剂，例如小苏打和白醋的混合溶液，都能有效去除霉菌和异味。

保持浴室通风也是防止霉菌滋生的重要措施。淋浴后，应及时打开窗户或开启排风扇，将湿气排出室外。如果浴室没有窗户，可以考虑安装排风扇，或者使用除湿机，降低空气湿度。

The old woman clutched the worn, leather-bound book. Its pages, brittle with age, whispered secrets only she could understand.  "Never gonna give you up," she murmured, the words a familiar comfort.

She wasn't talking about love, or a broken heart, or any of the things the song on the radio implied.  No, this was about the bakery. Her bakery. The one her grandfather had started, the one her father had nurtured, and the one she had sworn to protect.

"Never gonna let you down," she continued, tracing a finger across a faded photograph tucked within the book.  It showed a younger her, flour dusting her apron, a wide smile illuminating her face. The bakery, in the background, bustled with life.

The photograph was a stark contrast to the empty street outside.  A gleaming, modern cafe had opened across the road, its sleek chrome and neon lights a siren call to the younger generation. Her bakery, with its warm, inviting scent of cinnamon and yeast, felt suddenly old-fashioned.

"Never gonna run around and desert you."  Her voice was firm, resolute. She wouldn't abandon the legacy.  She wouldn't let the changing times dictate her fate.

The bell above the door chimed, a rare sound these days. A young girl stood hesitantly in the doorway, her eyes wide with wonder. The scent of freshly baked bread hung heavy in the air.

"Grandma," a voice called from behind the girl. A young mother entered, a smile playing on her lips. "I told you this place was special."

The little girl pointed towards a display of pastries, her finger hovering over a glazed cinnamon bun.  The old woman’s heart swelled.

"Never gonna make you cry," she whispered, a renewed sense of purpose filling her.  She would adapt, she would evolve, but she would never surrender.

"Never gonna say goodbye," she added, retrieving a pair of tongs. The bakery was more than just a building; it was a living, breathing part of her, a connection to the past and a bridge to the future.

曼谷近日示威活动呈现新趋势，抗议者不再坚守固定地点长期集会，而是采取“快闪”战术，迅速聚集、表达诉求，然后快速 dispersal，以避免与警方直接冲突。他们的目标也从以往的占领政府机构或公共场所，转变为瘫痪城市交通，以此向政府施加压力。

抗议者利用社交媒体平台，实时发布集会信息，号召民众参与。这些信息通常只提前很短时间发布，让警方难以预先部署警力进行拦截。抗议地点也常常出人意料，遍布曼谷市中心各个交通要道。

这种“快闪”战术的灵活性，给警方带来了极大的挑战。警力部署往往滞后，难以有效控制局面。抗议者迅速聚集，堵塞交通，表达诉求后迅速离开，让警方疲于奔命。

示威者表示，选择瘫痪交通作为抗争方式，是为了最大程度地减少人员伤亡和被捕风险，同时也能有效地向政府施加压力。交通瘫痪带来的经济损失和社会不便，会迫使政府更加重视他们的诉求。

然而，这种抗议方式也引发了部分民众的不满。交通堵塞给市民出行带来不便，影响了正常的生产生活秩序。一些商家也抱怨生意受到影响，呼吁政府尽快解决问题。

政府方面表示，尊重民众表达诉求的权利，但同时也强调，抗议活动必须在法律框架内进行，不得扰乱公共秩序。警方将加强巡逻和监控，维护社会稳定。

分析人士指出，这种“快闪”式抗议活动反映了泰国社会当前的紧张局势。抗议者与政府之间的博弈仍在继续，未来局势如何发展仍有待观察。

抗议活动的诉求依然围绕着修改宪法、改革君主立宪制以及总理下台等核心议题。此次“快闪”战术的运用，也显示了抗议者在策略上的不断调整和创新。

泰国政局的未来走向，将取决于政府如何回应民众的诉求，以及抗议者如何调整抗争策略。这场博弈的最终结果，将深刻影响泰国的未来发展。

L'ancien Premier ministre français, Manuel Valls, a essuyé un revers cuisant lors des élections municipales de Barcelone en 2019.  Porté par l'ambition de conquérir la mairie de la capitale catalane,  il n'a finalement pas réussi à s'imposer face à Ada Colau, la maire sortante.  Son pari, audacieux et médiatisé, s'est soldé par un échec retentissant,  l'empêchant même d'obtenir un siège au conseil municipal.  Arrivé en cinquième position avec seulement 5,2% des voix,  Valls a payé le prix d'une campagne jugée erratique et déconnectée des préoccupations des Barcelonais.  Son image de politicien français venu "sauver" Barcelone a été mal perçue,  renforçant le sentiment d'une candidature opportuniste.  Il a également peiné à convaincre sur son programme,  jugé flou et manquant de propositions concrètes pour la ville.  Son opposition frontale à l'indépendance de la Catalogne,  un sujet sensible dans la région, a par ailleurs  contribué à son isolement politique.  L'alliance de dernière minute avec le candidat de centre-droit,  loin de lui apporter le soutien escompté, a  au contraire brouillé son positionnement et  accentué l'impression d'un manque de cohérence idéologique.  Cette défaite marque un coup d'arrêt brutal dans la carrière politique de Manuel Valls,  qui avait quitté la France avec l'espoir d'un nouveau départ  en Espagne, son pays de naissance.  L'aventure barcelonaise s'achève donc sur une note amère,  laissant l'ancien Premier ministre  face à un avenir politique incertain.

La Comisión Interamericana de Derechos Humanos (CIDH) ha emitido un contundente informe sobre la situación en Chile, afirmando la existencia de violaciones a los Derechos Humanos en el país.  El documento, fruto de una exhaustiva investigación, detalla una serie de preocupaciones que van desde el uso excesivo de la fuerza por parte de las fuerzas de seguridad hasta la restricción de la libertad de expresión y reunión.

La CIDH expresa su profunda preocupación por el número de denuncias recibidas sobre el uso desproporcionado de la fuerza durante las manifestaciones sociales que han sacudido al país en los últimos años.  El informe destaca casos de lesiones graves, incluyendo traumas oculares, provocados por el uso indiscriminado de perdigones y gases lacrimógenos por parte de la policía.

Asimismo, la Comisión señala la persistencia de patrones de detenciones arbitrarias y malos tratos a personas detenidas.  Se han documentado casos de personas privadas de libertad sin acceso a asistencia legal y sometidas a tratos inhumanos y degradantes durante su detención.

La CIDH también manifiesta su inquietud por las restricciones impuestas a la libertad de expresión y el derecho a la protesta pacífica.  El informe subraya la criminalización de la protesta social y el uso de leyes antiterroristas para silenciar las voces disidentes.

Otro punto crítico resaltado por la Comisión es la situación de los pueblos indígenas en Chile.  El informe denuncia la vulneración sistemática de sus derechos territoriales, culturales y lingüísticos, así como la falta de consulta previa e informada en proyectos que afectan sus tierras ancestrales.

La CIDH insta al Estado chileno a adoptar medidas urgentes para garantizar el pleno respeto a los Derechos Humanos.  La Comisión recomienda la implementación de reformas estructurales en materia de seguridad ciudadana, justicia y protección de los derechos de los pueblos indígenas.

El informe de la CIDH representa un llamado de atención a la comunidad internacional sobre la grave situación de los Derechos Humanos en Chile.  La Comisión exhorta a la comunidad internacional a mantenerse vigilante y a exigir al Estado chileno el cumplimiento de sus obligaciones internacionales en materia de Derechos Humanos.

El gobierno chileno ha respondido al informe de la CIDH, reconociendo la necesidad de abordar las preocupaciones planteadas.  Sin embargo, ha rechazado categóricamente las acusaciones de violaciones sistemáticas de los Derechos Humanos, argumentando que se trata de casos aislados.

La publicación del informe de la CIDH abre un nuevo capítulo en el debate sobre la situación de los Derechos Humanos en Chile.

The pursuit of optimal solutions in combinatorial optimization problems often encounters the challenge of incorporating complex real-world constraints.  While traditional approaches focus on maximizing or minimizing an objective function subject to basic constraints, the growing complexity of modern problems necessitates the consideration of fairness, diversity, and global structural limitations.  This paper investigates the intricate interplay between satisfiability, coverage, and these advanced constraints, specifically focusing on fairness criteria, matroid constraints, and global constraints.  We delve into the theoretical foundations of these concepts and explore the algorithmic implications of incorporating them into optimization frameworks.  The primary motivation stems from the increasing demand for solutions that not only optimize a specific objective but also adhere to ethical, representational, and structural requirements.  Examples of such problems include fair allocation of resources, diverse team formation, and network design under global connectivity restrictions.  By addressing the theoretical and computational aspects of incorporating these constraints, we aim to contribute to a deeper understanding and more effective solutions for this class of challenging problems.

Fairness constraints arise in various applications where equitable distribution or representation is paramount.  They aim to mitigate bias and ensure proportional representation across different groups or individuals.  Matroid constraints, on the other hand, capture dependencies and exclusivity relationships among elements, enabling the modeling of complex selection criteria.  Global constraints enforce overarching structural properties on the solution, representing restrictions that apply to the solution as a whole rather than individual elements.  The simultaneous consideration of these constraints presents a significant challenge, as they often conflict and require intricate trade-offs.  Existing literature has primarily addressed these constraints in isolation.  However, the increasing demand for holistic solutions necessitates the development of integrated frameworks that can effectively handle their combined influence.  This research bridges this gap by exploring the theoretical and algorithmic implications of integrating fairness, matroid, and global constraints within a coverage maximization framework.

Specifically, we investigate the problem of maximizing coverage while adhering to these constraints.  Coverage problems involve selecting a subset of elements to maximize the coverage of a given set of targets.  We extend this classic problem by incorporating fairness criteria, matroid constraints on the selected elements, and global constraints that restrict the overall structure of the solution.

The fluorescent lights of the cafeteria hummed, casting a sterile glow over the usual lunchtime chaos.  Pizza grease hung heavy in the air, mingling with the scent of stale milk and teenage angst. I sat across from Sarah, my best friend since kindergarten, dissecting the complexities of Mrs. Davison's latest pop quiz.  We were mid-sentence, debating the merits of multiple-choice versus essay questions, when a sudden, sharp crack echoed through the room.

It wasn't the familiar bang of a locker slamming shut or the clatter of trays hitting the tiled floor. This sound was different – sharper, more sinister.  A collective gasp rippled through the cafeteria, followed by an eerie silence. Then, another crack, closer this time, accompanied by a scream that was abruptly cut short.

Confusion morphed into terror as students scrambled to their feet, tables and chairs overturning in the ensuing panic. Sarah grabbed my hand, her knuckles white against mine.  "Come on!" she yelled, pulling me towards the nearest exit.

We stumbled through the surging crowd, the air thick with fear and adrenaline.  As we neared the doorway, a figure emerged from the swirling mass of students. It was Mark, a quiet kid from our math class, his face contorted in a mask of terror.  His shirt was stained crimson, a stark contrast to the pale linoleum floor.

Before I could process what I was seeing, a hand clamped down on my shoulder. I turned to see Sarah, her eyes wide and unfocused, a strange glint in their depths. New Zealand's housing market has reached a new milestone, with the average house price surpassing $600,000 for the first time in history.  This surge represents a significant increase from the previous year's average and underscores the ongoing robust demand for residential properties across the country.

This figure reflects a substantial 12.5% jump compared to the same period last year and marks a new peak in the nation's property market.

Driving this upward trend are several key factors, including persistently low interest rates, a limited supply of available homes, and strong buyer competition.  These elements have combined to create an environment where property values continue to ascend.

The REINZ data also shed light on regional variations within the broader national trend.  While the national average tells one story, zooming in on specific areas reveals localized market dynamics at play.

Among the regions experiencing the most rapid price growth, six stand out.  These areas have witnessed remarkable surges in property values, surpassing the national average and reflecting unique local conditions.

Leading the pack is Carterton, a rural town located in the Wairarapa region of the North Island.  Carterton boasts the fastest-rising house prices in New Zealand, with values soaring by a remarkable 36.1% in the past year.  This surge underscores the town's growing popularity and the desirability of its lifestyle offerings.

Following closely behind Carterton is South Wairarapa, also situated in the lower North Island.  South Wairarapa has experienced a significant 34.1% increase in house prices over the past year, further highlighting the attractiveness of the Wairarapa region as a whole.

Masterton, another town in the Wairarapa, claims the third spot in the list of fastest-rising areas.  With a 28.8% year-on-year increase in house prices, Masterton reinforces the region's strong performance in the property market.

Tararua, a district located in the Manawatū-Whanganui region, takes the fourth position.  Tararua has seen its house prices surge by 28.7% in the past year, indicating the increasing demand for properties in this area.

漫话国乐并非仅限于丝竹管弦的宏大叙事，有时，一把牙筝，几缕散调，便足以勾勒出音画交融的诗意境界。铁牙筝，这种古老而独特的乐器，以其清脆明亮、略带金属质感的音色，在众多民族乐器中独树一帜。此次，我们将聚焦于牙筝/铁牙筝散调，特别是以“月光游戏”为主题，探讨其艺术魅力与文化内涵。

牙筝，又称铁牙筝，因其琴码以金属制成而得名。它流行于中国西南地区，特别是云南彝族、白族等少数民族聚居区。不同于古筝的温婉典雅，牙筝的音色更加清亮、高亢，更具穿透力，尤其适合表现欢快、热烈的情绪。在山间田野，在节日庆典，牙筝的旋律常常伴随着人们的歌声与舞蹈，成为生活中不可或缺的一部分。

“散调”是指没有固定曲谱、即兴演奏的音乐形式。牙筝散调，正是基于这种自由 improvisational 的演奏方式，结合了地方音乐的特色，形成了独特的艺术风格。演奏者可以根据自己的理解和感受，自由发挥，创造出变化多端、富有感染力的音乐。

“月光游戏”这一主题，为牙筝散调注入了浪漫主义色彩。月光，象征着宁静、神秘、梦幻，也代表着人们对美好生活的向往。在牙筝清脆的音符中，我们仿佛可以看到月光洒满大地，听到山间清泉流淌，感受到大自然的宁静与和谐。

想象一下，在月朗星稀的夜晚，一位演奏者盘腿而坐，指尖轻拨琴弦，牙筝的音符如精灵般跳跃，时而轻柔如 whispers，时而激昂如 mountain streams。这便是“月光游戏”所描绘的意境，它将听众带入一个充满诗情画意的梦幻世界。

牙筝散调的魅力，不仅在于其独特的音色和即兴演奏的自由，更在于它所承载的文化内涵。它反映了少数民族人民的生活方式、审美情趣和精神追求，是中华民族多元文化的重要组成部分。

传承和发展牙筝艺术，需要更多人的关注和支持。希望通过“月光游戏”等主题的创作和演绎，能够让更多人了解和喜爱这门古老的艺术，感受其独特的魅力。

Three-dimensional (3D) video representation and display have long been a pursuit of computer graphics and vision researchers, driven by the promise of immersive and interactive experiences.  Traditional approaches using stereo or multiview video offer a degree of depth perception, but they are fundamentally limited by fixed viewpoints dictated by camera placement during capture. This restriction inherently limits the user's freedom to explore the scene from arbitrary perspectives, a constraint that volumetric video aims to overcome.  Volumetric video represents dynamic scenes as a time-varying 3D structure, effectively capturing the evolution of objects and their spatial relationships over time.  This approach unlocks the potential for true six degrees of freedom (6DoF) viewing experiences, allowing the user to navigate and interact with the captured scene as if physically present within the environment.  The ability to freely explore a dynamic 3D scene holds transformative potential across a wide spectrum of applications, from entertainment and gaming to medical training and cultural heritage preservation.

The realization of high-quality volumetric video presents a complex interplay of challenges across various domains, encompassing capture, processing, compression, transmission, and rendering.  Capturing dynamic 3D scenes requires specialized multi-camera systems or depth sensors, capable of acquiring detailed geometric and appearance information.  The captured data typically comprises dense point clouds, meshes, or implicit representations, each posing unique challenges for processing and manipulation. Once captured, the volumetric data requires efficient compression techniques to manage the substantial data sizes inherent in representing time-varying 3D structures.  The compressed data must then be transmitted efficiently, necessitating robust networking infrastructure and specialized streaming protocols capable of handling the bandwidth demands of volumetric video.  Finally, rendering the volumetric data for interactive display demands sophisticated algorithms capable of reconstructing and rendering the 3D scene from arbitrary viewpoints in real-time, creating a seamless and immersive viewing experience for the user.

This paper provides a comprehensive survey of the evolving landscape of volumetric video, examining the advancements and remaining challenges across the entire pipeline, from capture to display.  We delve into the various capture technologies, comparing and contrasting their strengths and limitations in terms of accuracy, resolution, and practicality.  We explore different volumetric representations, analyzing their suitability for various applications and their impact on processing and compression efficiency.  Further, we discuss the latest advancements in compression techniques designed to address the substantial data requirements of volumetric video, focusing on both lossy and lossless compression strategies.  We also analyze the ongoing research in efficient transmission protocols, including adaptive streaming and point cloud compression strategies tailored for volumetric content.

Finally, we investigate the state-of-the-art rendering techniques used to display volumetric video, highlighting the trade-offs between rendering quality, computational complexity, and real-time performance. We provide a detailed analysis of existing volumetric video datasets and evaluation metrics, outlining the benchmarks used to assess the performance of different techniques across the pipeline.  By offering a holistic overview of the current state of volumetric video, this survey aims to serve as a valuable resource for researchers and practitioners alike, fostering further innovation and development in this rapidly evolving field.  Furthermore, we identify key open research questions and future directions that are crucial for advancing the state of the art and realizing the full potential of volumetric video technology, paving the way for truly immersive and interactive 3D experiences.

The proliferation of large, pre-trained models has revolutionized the field of computer vision, empowering a wide spectrum of downstream tasks with enhanced performance. These models, often trained on massive datasets using self-supervised learning, learn rich representations of the visual world without relying on explicit human annotations. However, the sheer size and computational demands of these models pose significant challenges for deployment on resource-constrained devices, particularly in edge computing scenarios where real-time processing is critical.  This computational bottleneck has spurred the development of knowledge distillation techniques, aiming to transfer the knowledge embedded within these cumbersome teachers to smaller, more efficient student models.  The goal is to achieve comparable performance with significantly reduced computational overhead, democratizing access to state-of-the-art computer vision capabilities across a broader range of applications.

Knowledge distillation, in essence, involves training a compact student network to mimic the output distributions of a larger, pre-trained teacher network.  This process goes beyond simply matching the final predictions; it encourages the student to learn the underlying feature representations and internal knowledge embedded within the teacher. This transfer of knowledge is often achieved by minimizing a divergence measure between the probability distributions produced by the teacher and the student, effectively guiding the student towards a similar understanding of the data.  While traditional knowledge distillation methods have demonstrated success in transferring knowledge from supervised teachers, their application to self-supervised models presents unique challenges. The inherent absence of explicit labels in self-supervised learning necessitates the development of novel strategies to effectively distill the rich, yet implicit, knowledge captured by these models.

This paper introduces MOMA (Momentum-based Model Aggregation for Distillation), a novel framework specifically designed for distilling knowledge from self-supervised teachers. MOMA addresses the challenges posed by the lack of explicit labels by leveraging the momentum encoder, a key component often used in self-supervised learning frameworks. The momentum encoder maintains a slowly evolving representation of the data, providing a more stable and consistent target for the student to learn from.  By aggregating the outputs of the momentum encoder over multiple epochs, MOMA creates a rich and robust target distribution that encapsulates the temporal dynamics of the self-supervised learning process. This aggregated representation provides a more comprehensive and stable source of knowledge for the student, leading to improved performance and faster convergence.

Unlike existing methods that focus solely on mimicking the instantaneous output of the teacher, MOMA takes a more holistic approach, capturing the temporal evolution of the teacher's understanding.  This temporal aggregation effectively smooths out the noise and fluctuations inherent in the self-supervised learning process, providing a more reliable target for the student.  Furthermore, MOMA leverages the momentum encoder’s inherent ability to capture long-term dependencies within the data, enabling the student to learn more robust and generalizable representations. This novel approach allows for a more effective transfer of knowledge, leading to significant improvements in student performance compared to existing distillation techniques.

In this work, we evaluate MOMA on a variety of downstream tasks, demonstrating its effectiveness in distilling knowledge from different self-supervised learning frameworks.

The Facial Action Coding System (FACS), detailed in "Making Mona Lisa Smile," offers a compelling new approach to understanding human emotion. By meticulously mapping facial muscles, FACS allows computers to identify subtle nuances in expression, theoretically providing insight into a person's emotional state. While this technology holds promise in diverse fields, its application in classrooms raises complex questions regarding student privacy and the potential for misinterpretation.  The benefits of using FACS to gauge student engagement and comprehension are readily apparent. A teacher could, in theory, tailor instruction in real-time based on students' observed emotional responses, ensuring material resonates effectively.

However, the classroom application of FACS raises ethical concerns. Students, particularly younger ones, may not possess the emotional maturity or self-awareness to accurately reflect their true feelings through facial expressions.  Furthermore, cultural differences in expressing emotion can be substantial, leading to misinterpretations by a standardized system.  Imagine a student from a culture where displaying enthusiasm is considered inappropriate being misconstrued as disengaged or bored.  Relying solely on facial analysis risks overlooking valuable contextual information crucial to understanding a student’s true emotional state.

Implementing FACS in the classroom without careful consideration of these limitations could create an environment where students feel constantly monitored and judged.  This constant surveillance could stifle genuine emotional expression and lead to a chilling effect on classroom participation.

The advent of deep learning has revolutionized computer vision, propelling significant advancements in various tasks, including semantic segmentation.  Semantic segmentation, the pixel-level classification of images, plays a crucial role in diverse applications ranging from autonomous driving and medical image analysis to robotics and satellite imagery interpretation.  The quest for more accurate and efficient semantic segmentation models has led to the exploration of various architectures, with transformer-based models emerging as a promising frontier.  These models, inspired by the success of transformers in natural language processing, leverage self-attention mechanisms to capture long-range dependencies and contextual information within images, offering potential advantages over traditional convolutional neural networks.

While transformers have demonstrated impressive performance in image classification and object detection, their application to semantic segmentation presents unique challenges.  The computational complexity of self-attention grows quadratically with the input size, making it computationally expensive for high-resolution images commonly encountered in semantic segmentation tasks.  This computational burden limits the applicability of transformers to large-scale datasets and high-resolution images, hindering their broader adoption in real-world scenarios.  Furthermore, the inherent global receptive field of transformers can sometimes be detrimental to capturing fine-grained details crucial for accurate segmentation, particularly at object boundaries.

Addressing these challenges requires innovative approaches to adapt transformers for efficient and effective semantic segmentation.  Several strategies have been proposed, including hierarchical transformers that process images at different resolutions, and hybrid architectures combining convolutional layers with transformer blocks.  These methods aim to strike a balance between computational efficiency and the ability to capture both global context and local details.  However, these approaches often involve complex architectural designs and extensive hyperparameter tuning, adding to the complexity of model development and deployment.

This paper introduces the Transformer Scale Gate (TSG), a novel mechanism designed to enhance the efficiency and performance of transformer-based semantic segmentation models.  The TSG operates by selectively applying self-attention at different scales within the image, thereby optimizing the computational resources allocated to different regions.  Specifically, the TSG learns to dynamically gate the flow of information through the transformer, focusing computational resources on regions requiring more detailed analysis, while employing a more efficient processing strategy for less complex regions.  This adaptive scaling allows the model to capture both global context and fine-grained details while maintaining computational efficiency.

The core idea behind the TSG is to leverage the inherent multi-scale nature of images.  Natural images often exhibit varying levels of detail across different regions.  For instance, the background may contain large homogeneous areas requiring less detailed analysis, while object boundaries and intricate textures demand finer-grained processing.  The TSG exploits this observation by learning to identify regions requiring different levels of detail and dynamically adjusting the scale of self-attention accordingly.  This scale-adaptive processing significantly reduces the computational cost associated with applying self-attention to the entire image at a uniform high resolution.

We evaluate the effectiveness of the TSG on several challenging semantic segmentation benchmarks, including Cityscapes, ADE20K, and Pascal VOC.  Our experimental results demonstrate that the TSG consistently improves the performance of transformer-based models while reducing computational complexity.  We show that the TSG enables the model to achieve state-of-the-art performance with significantly fewer computational resources compared to existing methods.

The Facial Action Coding System (FACS), a technology capable of deciphering human emotions, presents a complex dilemma when considering its application in classrooms. While proponents might argue for its potential to personalize learning and provide valuable feedback to teachers, the potential drawbacks raise significant concerns about privacy and the potential for misinterpretation.  The article "Making Mona Lisa Smile" describes FACS's ability to identify subtle muscle movements associated with specific emotions.  In a classroom setting, this could theoretically alert teachers to students struggling with the material, allowing for tailored interventions.  It could also identify students who are disengaged or bored, enabling educators to adjust their teaching strategies.  However, the very premise of constant emotional surveillance creates an unsettling environment, potentially stifling genuine emotional expression and fostering a sense of unease amongst students.


The inherent limitations of FACS further complicate its classroom application.  Emotions are multifaceted and influenced by cultural and individual contexts. A student's furrowed brow might indicate confusion, or simply deep concentration. Relying on FACS to gauge understanding might lead to misinterpretations and inaccurate assessments.  Furthermore, the ethical implications of collecting and analyzing students’ emotional data raise serious privacy concerns.  Who has access to this data?  How is it being used?  The potential for misuse, bias, and stigmatization is undeniable.  While the allure of personalized learning is appealing, the potential chilling effect on free expression and the privacy concerns associated with FACS suggest its use in the classroom is more detrimental than beneficial.

Le tatouage, autrefois symbole d'engagement permanent, est devenu pour certains une forme d'expression plus éphémère.  De nombreuses célébrités, après avoir fièrement arboré des dessins, des noms ou des citations sur leur peau, choisissent aujourd'hui de les faire disparaître.  Le détatouage au laser, technique de plus en plus performante, permet d'effacer ces marques du passé, ouvrant la voie à une nouvelle esthétique ou simplement à un retour à une peau vierge.  Les motivations sont variées, allant du regret d'un tatouage impulsif à l'évolution des goûts personnels, en passant par les exigences professionnelles.

Parmi les stars ayant opté pour le détatouage, on retrouve notamment Angelina Jolie.  L'actrice, connue pour ses nombreux tatouages, a fait effacer plusieurs d'entre eux, dont le nom de son ancien époux, Billy Bob Thornton.  Ce choix symbolique reflète souvent une volonté de tourner la page et de se détacher d'une période de sa vie.  D'autres personnalités, comme Megan Fox, ont également eu recours au laser pour effacer des tatouages jugés trop visibles ou inadaptés à leur image actuelle.  Le détatouage devient ainsi un moyen de se réinventer et de contrôler son image publique.

Le processus de détatouage au laser est relativement long et peut nécessiter plusieurs séances, espacées de plusieurs semaines.  Le laser cible les pigments du tatouage et les fragmente en particules microscopiques, ensuite éliminées par le système immunitaire.  La douleur ressentie est souvent comparée à celle d'un élastique qui claque sur la peau, mais elle peut varier en fonction de la taille, de la couleur et de l'emplacement du tatouage.

The Facial Action Coding System (FACS), detailed in "Making Mona Lisa Smile," offers a potentially valuable tool for understanding student engagement and emotional state in the classroom. The ability to identify confusion or disinterest could be particularly beneficial in large classrooms where individual attention is challenging.

Misinterpretations could lead to mischaracterizations of students' emotional states and inappropriate interventions.  Therefore, while FACS holds promise for enhancing classroom learning, careful consideration of its ethical implications and implementation is essential to ensure its responsible and effective use.

The insistent buzzing of my phone ripped me from a sound sleep. Groggily, I fumbled for the device, squinting at the bright screen. It was Mark, his name flashing with an urgency that jolted me awake.

"He did it," I muttered, a mix of disbelief and anticipation swirling within me.  For years, Mark had been obsessed with teleportation. His apartment window overlooked a small park with a weathered wooden bench, his chosen destination for his imagined journeys.  He'd spend hours staring at it, concentrating with an intensity that bordered on comical.

I answered the call, Mark's breathless voice filling my ear. "I did it! I teleported!"

My skepticism battled with a flicker of excitement.  "Mark, are you sure?"

"Yes! I was focusing on the bench, like always, and then... whoosh! I was there!"

Intrigued, I threw on some clothes and rushed to the park. The crisp morning air nipped at my face as I approached the bench.  And there he was, Mark, sitting exactly where he'd envisioned himself.

A slow smile spread across my face as I realized what had happened.

Mark, in his years of observing the park, had become intimately familiar with its rhythms. He knew the dog walkers' routines, the joggers' schedules, the old woman who fed the pigeons every morning at precisely 7:15.

He had, without realizing it, become a master of prediction.

That morning, he had seen Mrs. Henderson, the pigeon lady, approaching the park.  He'd seen the familiar flash of blue as Mr. Johnson, the jogger, rounded the corner. He'd noted the absence of the usual dog walkers, indicating a shift in their routine.

Subconsciously, he'd processed all this information, and, in a moment of intense concentration, convinced himself he had teleported.

In reality, he had simply anticipated the park's emptiness, chosen the opportune moment, and walked there unnoticed.

His conviction, however, was unshakeable.  He regaled me with tales of his "instantaneous" journey, the "whooshing" sensation, the "disorientation" of arrival.

I listened patiently, a smile playing on my lips.  It was a harmless delusion, born of a fervent desire and years of dedicated observation.
